results.headline: Don’t Just Pass the Joint, Sell It
results.summary_short: “Kid Cannabis” tells a drug empire tale based on the real-life story of an Idaho teenager who organized a smuggling operation that brought marijuana in from Canada.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kid Cannabis

results.headline: A Plea for Equal Pay for Equal Pedaling
results.summary_short: In this documentary, Kathryn Bertine, an athlete and former ESPN columnist, questions the male-dominated world of professional cycling.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Half The Road

results.headline: In an Uneven Economy, an Opening in the Service Sector Beckons
results.summary_short: John Turturro stars in and directs “Fading Gigolo,” a comedy about a New Yorker who is losing his job and is urged to try prostitution.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fading Gigolo

results.headline: I Am My Own Monster (Technology Rules!)
results.summary_short: “Transcendence” stars Johnny Depp as an artificial-intelligence genius whose wife uploads his consciousness into a supermachine after anti-technology extremists shoot him.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Transcendence

results.headline: Taking the Man Out of Oklahoma, Maybe
results.summary_short: “Home, James,” by Jonathan Rossetti, is a hymn to love and to Tulsa, Okla.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Home, James

results.headline: A Bear, Her Cubs and the Wilderness
results.summary_short: Disney’s “Bears” is the chronicle of a year in the hungry life of one bear and her two cubs in the Alaskan wilderness.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bears

results.headline: He Took the Dare to Change His Life
results.summary_short: A decent man in debt, hoping his troubles will end, agrees to fulfill a series of 13 dares, each rewarded with an escalating sum of money.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 13 Sins

results.headline: A Labor Leader’s Devotion to His Cause
results.summary_short: “Cesar’s Last Fast,” about Cesar Chavez, centers on a 36-day fast he endured to call attention to farmworker conditions.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cesar's Last Fast

results.headline: Waiting for ‘Waiting for Guffman,’ Sort Of
results.summary_short: Writers in Los Angeles waiting to be published are the title characters in “Authors Anonymous.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Authors Anonymous

results.headline: That Thing He Had for the Boss’s Wife
results.summary_short: “A Promise,” the first English-language film by the French director Patrice Leconte, tells the story of an industrialist, his wife and his assistant.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Promise

results.headline: Two Artistic Outlooks, Heightened Side by Side
results.summary_short: Two artists, Mary Frank and Tacita Dean, play roles in two documentaries being shown together at Film Forum.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of JG

results.headline: His Résumé Before the Age of 4: ‘I Saw Jesus on a Horse’
results.summary_short: The 2010 best-selling book “Heaven Is for Real” has made it to the screen, starring Greg Kinnear.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Heaven is for Real

results.headline: At One With Their Dogs, Growling and Snapping
results.summary_short: In David Gordon Green’s “Joe,” Nicolas Cage stars as a steely ex-convict who tries to help a boy with an abusive home life.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Joe

results.headline: The Question Is Whodunit; the Answer Is Clear
results.summary_short: The shooting deaths of a Sept. 11 conspiracy theorist and his two teenage children were ruled a murder-suicide, but “Unthinkable” takes a different view.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Unthinkable

results.display_title: Thomas Keating: A Rising Tide of Silence
results.headline: Breaking Silence on a Monk
results.summary_short: “Thomas Keating: A Rising Tide of Silence” is a reverent collection of interviews and archival speeches about its subject, a Trappist monk.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Thomas Keating: A Rising Tide of Silence

results.headline: Lifetime Anguish Is the High Cost of Courage
results.summary_short: Colin Firth stars as Eric Lomax, a British Army officer who served and suffered during World War II, in this movie based on Lomax’s memoir.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Railway Man

results.headline: An Alfresco Fling Beats Selling Tractors
results.summary_short: Alain Guiraudie’s “The King of Escape” follows a middle-aged gay tractor salesman who finds himself in a heterosexual mood after rescuing a teenage girl, so he runs away with her.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The King of Escape

results.headline: A Man of God, and of Contradictions
results.summary_short: “The Jewish Cardinal,” by Ilan Duran Cohen, traces the life of the Jewish-born French cardinal, Jean-Marie Lustiger.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Jewish Cardinal

results.headline: Domesticated Macaws Reclaiming Their Wild Side
results.summary_short: In “Rio 2,” a mated pair of blue macaws and their brood leave Rio for the lush perils of the Amazon rain forest.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rio 2

results.headline: Teenagers, Fed Up, Hatch a Deadly Plan
results.summary_short: In “Perfect Sisters,” based on a true story, two Canadian siblings decide to kill their mother.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Perfect Sisters
